Text: Using the newer approach is a good thing!
Good answer. I think I’d use `for (Month month : Month.values())`. I might also require a `DayOfWeek` enum constant (or convert to one) so I avoided the `getDisplayName()` call in each iteration.

@OleV.V. Thought about using `Month` but didn't see the second `of` method until just now - will change it. The ugly `getDisplayName()` is kind of on purpose to keep it in line with the original comparison. But I agree that an enum would be the better choice.
Yes, see your point. The original code could have required or converted to `Calendar.SUNDAY` and used `cal.get(Calendar.DAY_OF_WEEK)`, but didn’t, so your code is more in line with how it did.
I've added a second approach using the enum if the string comparison was not intentional.
There’s a great coherence between the newer classes and enums. Once you get used to it, you will find it natural to expect that you can pass a `Month` to the factory methods of the other classes.
As Ole V.V. suggested, I would focus on using the [`DayOfWeek`](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/time/DayOfWeek.html) enum rather than a string of name of day-of-week.
